newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks tread near session lows.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks tread near session lows.

text.p: Wall Street stocks hovered near session lows Monday, after a higher-than-expected reading in the Chicago Purchasing Managers Index for June and a rise in single-family May home sales sent stocks and bonds down.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down around 54 points at 7634, after the New York Stock Exchange set trading curbs. The long bond was down 20/32 at a 6.79 percent yield.
The Nasdaq composite was down around four points at 1434.
"There is dearth of buyers," Doug Myers, vice president of equity trading at Interstate/Johnson Lane, said. Many players were sidelined before the Federal Reserve met, analysts said.
